title: Classicality of Stochastic Noise Away From Quasi-de Sitter Inflation
abstract:
It is well known that a coarse-grained scalar field living on a de~Sitter
(dS) background exhibits classical stochastic behavior, driven by a noise whose
amplitude is set by the Hubble constant $H$. The coarse-graining is achieved by
discarding wave numbers larger than a cutoff $\sigma H$ and demanding that
$\sigma \ll 1$. Similar results hold for quasi-dS space, where the equation of
state parameter $w$ is close to $-1$. Here we present exact expressions for the
noise amplitude of a free massless field on an inflationary background with
constant $w < -1/3$. We find that a classical stochastic behavior can emerge
for $-5/3 < w < -1/3$. Furthermore, as we move away from $w = -1$ and approach
$w = -1/3$, the constraint $\sigma \ll 1$ is relaxed and larger cutoffs
($\sigma \sim 1$) become feasible, too. However, in general the amplitude of
the noise depends on $\sigma$, except in the quasi-dS regime $w \approx -1$.
